Package noppes.npcs.api.entity

Interface IEntityLiving<T extends LivingEntity>

All Superinterfaces:
IEntity<T>
All Known Subinterfaces:
IAnimal<T>, ICustomNpc<T>, IMob<T>, IMonster<T>, IPixelmon<T>, IPlayer<T>, IVillager<T>
public interface IEntityLiving<T extends LivingEntity> extends IEntity<T>

Represents a living entity.

Prior to 1.16.5-14Nov21snapshot, this interface is named IEntityLivingBase. It is renamed as net.minecraft.entity.EntityLiving is refactored to net.minecraft.entity.LivingEntity (now refactored to LivingEntity.)

Prior to 1.8.9(29oct16), the interface is not generic.

  • Method Details

    • getHealth

      float getHealth()

      Gets the health of the living entity.

      Returns:
      The health of the living entity.

    • setHealth

      void setHealth(float health)

      Sets the health of the living entity.

      Parameters:
      health - The health.

      The set health is clamped between 0 (inclusive) and the max health of the living entity (inclusive.)

    • getMaxHealth

      float getMaxHealth()

      Gets the computed (actual) max health of the living entity.

      Returns:
      The computed (actual) max health of the living entity.

    • setMaxHealth

      void setMaxHealth(float health)

      Sets the base max health of the living entity.

      This method sets the base max health. The actual max health is computed based on the base max health, modified by the attribute modifiers.

      Parameters:
      health - The base max health.

      If health is less than 0, this method does nothing.

    • isAttacking

      boolean isAttacking()

      Gets whether the living entity has a last hurt-by entity or an attack target.

      The "last hurt-by entity" of a living entity E is the last living entity that hurt E and is still being tracked by E.

      Returns:
      Whether the living entity has a last hurt-by entity or an attack target.

    • setAttackTarget

      void setAttackTarget(IEntityLiving living)

      Sets the attack target (if the living entity is a mob) and the last hurt-by entity of the living entity.

      The "last hurt-by entity" of a living entity E is the last living entity that hurt E and is still being tracked by E.

      Parameters:
      living - The target and last hurt-by entity.

      If living is null, the attack target (if the living entity is a mob) and the last hurt-by entity will be cleared.

    • getAttackTarget

      IEntityLiving getAttackTarget()

      Gets the attack target (if the living entity is a mob) or the last hurt-by entity of the living entity.

      The "last hurt-by entity" of a living entity E is the last living entity that hurt E and is still being tracked by E.

      Returns:
      The attack target or the last hurt-by entity of the living entity.

      If the living entity have neither an attack target nor a last hurt-by entity, this method returns null.

    • getLastAttacked

      IEntityLiving getLastAttacked()

      Gets the living entity that the current living entity last attacked.

      Returns:
      The living entity that the current living entity last attacked.

    • getLastAttackedTime

      int getLastAttackedTime()

      Gets the timestamp when the living entity last attacked.

      Returns:
      The timestamp when the living entity last attacked.

      The returned timestamp can only be used in the context of the current entity and SHOULD NOT be compared with any timestamps obtained from other entities.

      Since:
      1.12.2_04Mar19snapshot

    • canSeeEntity

      boolean canSeeEntity(IEntity entity)

      Determines whether the living entity can see another entity.

      Parameters:
      entity - A non-null target entity.
      Returns:
      Whether the living entity can see the target entity.

    • getMainhandItem

      IItemStack getMainhandItem()

      Gets the item stack in the main hand of the living entity.

      Returns:
      The item stack in the main hand of the living entity.

      If the living entity is not holding an item in its main hand, this method returns an instance of IItemStack with its IItemStack.isEmpty() method returns true.

      Since:
      1.9.4(29oct16)

    • setMainhandItem

      void setMainhandItem(IItemStack item)

      Sets the item stack in the main hand of the living entity.

      Parameters:
      item - The item stack to be set to the main hand of the living entity.

      If item is null, an empty item stack will be set.

      Since:
      1.9.4(29oct16)

    • getOffhandItem

      IItemStack getOffhandItem()

      Gets the item stack in the off-hand of the living entity.

      Returns:
      The item stack in the off-hand of the living entity.

      If the living entity is not holding an item in its off-hand, this method returns an instance of IItemStack with its IItemStack.isEmpty() method returns true.

      Since:
      1.9.4(29oct16)

      If item is null, an empty item stack will be set.

    • getArmor

      IItemStack getArmor(int slot)

      Gets the item stack in an armor slot of the living entity.

      Parameters:
      slot - An armor slot of the living entity.

      Possible values for slot are:

      • 0, the feet slot;
      • 1, the legs slot;
      • 2, the chest slot;
      • 3, the head slot.
      Returns:
      The item stack in the specified armor slot of the living entity.

      If the specified slot is empty, or the living entity does not have armor slots, this method returns an instance of IItemStack with its IItemStack.isEmpty() method returns true.

      Throws:
      CustomNPCsException - slot is less than 0 or greater than 3.

    • setArmor

      void setArmor(int slot, IItemStack item)

      Sets the item stack in an armor slot of the living entity.

      Parameters:
      slot - An armor slot of the living entity.

      Possible values for slot are:

      • 0, the feet slot;
      • 1, the legs slot;
      • 2, the chest slot;
      • 3, the head slot.
      item - The item stack to be set to the specified armor slot of the living entity.

      If item is null, an empty item stack will be set.

      Throws:
      CustomNPCsException - slot is less than 0 or greater than 3.

    • addPotionEffect

      void addPotionEffect(int effect, int duration, int strength, boolean hideParticles)

      Gives the living entity a potion effect.

      Parameters:
      effect - The ID of the potion effect.

      If the given effect ID is invalid, this method does nothing.

      See the Minecraft Wiki for the ID of each effect.

      duration - The duration of the potion effect, in seconds for normal potion effects, or in game ticks for instant potion effects.

      duration is clamped between 0 (inclusive) and 1000000 (inclusive.)

      If duration is 0, the specified effect will be cleared.

      strength - The amplifier of the potion effect.

      strength is clamped between 0 (inclusive) and 255 (inclusive.)

      hideParticles - Whether the particles of the potion effect is visible.

      Note that setting hideParticles to true makes the particles visible, and setting it to false hides the particles, as opposed to the name of this parameter.

    • clearPotionEffects

      void clearPotionEffects()

      Clears all the potion effects on the living entity.

    • getPotionEffect

      int getPotionEffect(int effect)

      Gets the current amplifier of a potion effect on the living entity.

      Parameters:
      effect - The ID of the potion effect.
      Returns:
      The current amplifier of the specified potion effect on the living entity.

      If the given effect ID is invalid, or the living entity does not have the potion effect, this method returns -1.

    • addMark

      IMark addMark(int type)

      Adds a mark to the living entity.

      Parameters:
      type - The type of the mark.

      Possible values for type are:

      • 0, none;
      • 1, the question mark;
      • 2, the exclamation mark;
      • 3, the pointer mark;
      • 4, the skull mark;
      • 5, the cross mark;
      • 6, the star mark.
      Returns:
      The added mark.
      Since:
      1.11.2(29oct17)

    • removeMark

      void removeMark(IMark mark)

      Removes a mark from the living entity.

      Parameters:
      mark - The mark to be removed.
      Since:
      1.11.2(29oct17)

      Returns:

      Expert users only
      Specified by:

      Returns minecrafts entity

    • getMoveForward

      float getMoveForward()

      Gets the Z component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      Returns:
      The Z component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      A positive value indicates a forward movement, and a negative value indicates backward movement, relative to the current rotation of the living entity.

      If the magnitude of the travel vector is greater than 1, it will be normalized before used to calculate motion.

      The final velocity of the living entity is affected by other factors such as friction.

      Since:
      1.12.2_01sep18snapshot

    • setMoveForward

      void setMoveForward(float move)

      Sets the Z component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      Parameters:
      move - The Z component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      A positive value indicates a forward movement, and a negative value indicates backward movement, relative to the current rotation of the living entity.

      If the magnitude of the travel vector is greater than 1, it will be normalized before used to calculate motion.

      The final velocity of the living entity is affected by other factors such as friction.

      Since:
      1.12.2_01sep18snapshot

    • getMoveStrafing

      float getMoveStrafing()

      Gets the X component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      Returns:
      The X component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      A positive value indicates a rightward movement, and a negative value indicates leftward movement, relative to the current rotation of the living entity.

      If the magnitude of the travel vector is greater than 1, it will be normalized before used to calculate motion.

      The final velocity of the living entity is affected by other factors such as friction.

      Since:
      1.12.2_01sep18snapshot

    • setMoveStrafing

      void setMoveStrafing(float move)

      Sets the X component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      Parameters:
      move - The X component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      A positive value indicates a rightward movement, and a negative value indicates leftward movement, relative to the current rotation of the living entity.

      If the magnitude of the travel vector is greater than 1, it will be normalized before used to calculate motion.

      The final velocity of the living entity is affected by other factors such as friction.

      Since:
      1.12.2_01sep18snapshot

    • getMoveVertical

      float getMoveVertical()

      Gets the Y component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      Returns:
      The Y component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      A positive value indicates an upward movement, and a negative value indicates downward movement.

      If the magnitude of the travel vector is greater than 1, it will be normalized before used to calculate motion.

      The final velocity of the living entity is affected by other factors such as friction.

      Since:
      1.12.2_01sep18snapshot

    • setMoveVertical

      void setMoveVertical(float move)

      Sets the Y component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      Parameters:
      move - The Y component of the travel vector of the living entity.

      A positive value indicates an upward movement, and a negative value indicates downward movement.

      If the magnitude of the travel vector is greater than 1, it will be normalized before used to calculate motion.

      The final velocity of the living entity is affected by other factors such as friction.

      Since:
